title.native: 名探偵コナン　探偵たちの鎮魂歌[レクイエム]
title.english: Case Closed: Requiem of the Detectives

description:
After receiving a strange invitation, Kogorou Mouri pays a visit to the Miracle Land theme park along with his daughter Ran, Conan Edogawa, and the Detective Boys. Once there, Kogorou and Conan are tasked with finishing an unsolved case by a mysterious stranger. Realizing that the invitations were actually an elaborate trap, the two have just 12 hours to solve the case or face grave danger.

With the help of familiar faces like Heiji Hattori, Kaitou Kid, and even Saguru Hakuba, the group of detectives must unravel the web of clues surrounding the case in order to find the culprit and bring them to justice before it's too late.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: Meitantei Conan Movie 10: Tantei-tachi no Requiem
Detektiv Conan: Das Requiem der Detektive
Detective Conan Movie 10: Requiem per un Detective

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

title.native: 名探偵コナン　探偵たちの鎮魂歌[レクイエム]
名探偵コナン

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%93%E3%81%A0%E3%81%BE%E5%85%BC%E5%97%A3) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenji_Kodama)

Kenji Kodama is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He is best known for being one of the main directors on the long-running anime [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/), as well as the [City Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/1470/) series and [Lupin III: Part III](https://anilist.co/anime/1426/).

Married to animator [Sachiko Kamimura](https://anilist.co/staff/112663/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Official Site](https://bz-vermillion.com) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Bz) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Bz_Official)

B'z  is a Japanese hard rock duo.   

Members: 
Tak Matsumoto (松本孝弘) - composition, guitar 
[Koshi Inaba](https://anilist.co/staff/264247) (稲葉浩志) - lyrics, vocals

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西香代子)

She is also a published novelist.
Lead vocalist of the rock duo __[B'z](https://anilist.co/staff/102048/Bz)__.
